== Main Inclusion Report for libwoodstox-java ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/libw/libwoodstox-java]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures.
# ''Rationale:''
** New dependency of eucalyptus 1.6.2
 0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=woodstox|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: none
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=woodstox|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: none
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid, no daemons.
** No Network activity, no direct binary processing.
** No source code review performed.
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Package is a Java library, works out of the box without configuration.
** No debconf questions higher than priority 'medium'.
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:libwoodstox-java|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: none
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/libw/libwoodstox-java.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is calm.
** <nowiki>[[http://woodstox.codehaus.org/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is vigorous, though mainly working on the 4.0 branch now.
** <nowiki>[[http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/WSTX|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>: nothing outstanding.
** Hardware: This package doesn't deal with hardware, runs inside a JVM.
** There is a basic test suite in the upstream source, but it is not enabled in the Debian packaging.
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** Package follows <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki>, and Java Debian and Ubuntu policies.
** Package is using classic CDBS/ant packaging, as most Java libraries.
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** No dependencies that are not in main already.
 0. ''Maintenance:''
** Little maintenance is expected: this package has no bugs filed and is maintained by the debian-java team.
** The debian-java team, with its few Ubuntu members, is responsible for monitoring the quality of this package and fixing its bugs.
 0. ''Background information:''
** Package purpose is clear from its description.
** Upstream calls this software "Woodstox"
